ev3dev.hardware.sensors.ev3

Class EV3UltrasonicSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ev3dev.hardware.Device
      • ev3dev.hardware.EV3DevDevice
        • ev3dev.hardware.EV3DevSensorDevice
          • ev3dev.hardware.sensors.BaseSensor
            • ev3dev.hardware.sensors.ev3.EV3UltrasonicSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SensorMode, SensorModes, SupportedPlatform, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, SampleProvider

    public class EV3UltrasonicSensor
extends BaseSensor
    Lego EV3 Ultrasonic sensors
    The EV3 Ultrasonic sensors measures distance to an object in front of the sensors. It can also be used to detect other (active) Ultrasonic sensors in the vicinity.

    Sensor configuration
    The sensors can be switched off and on using the enable() and disable() methods. Disabling the sensors also shuts down the lights.

    See Sensor Product page See The leJOS sensors framework See leJOS conventions for SampleProviders

      • getListenMode

        public SampleProvider getListenMode()
        Lego EV3 Ultrasonic sensors, Listen mode
        Listens for the presence of other ultrasonic sensors.

        Size and content of the sample
        The sample contains one elements indicating the presence of another ultrasonic sensors. A value of 1 indicates that the sensors detects another ultrasonic sensors.

        Returns:
        A sampleProvider

        Size and content of the sample

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enable the sensors. This puts the indicater LED on.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disable the sensors. This puts the indicater LED off.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Indicate that the sensors is enabled.
        Returns:
        True, when the sensors is enabled.
        False, when the sensors is disabled.
